techmeme.title: WhatsApp is testing limits on how many messages a user or business can send monthly to unknown people without a response; nearing the limit displays a warning (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
European automakers warn of a substantial disruption to production after China cut off Nexperia's outbound shipments due to the Netherlands' seizure of Nexperia (Financial Times)
A look at the challenges facing Europe's chip industry, as the EU will likely fail to increase its 10% global chip manufacturing share to a targeted 20% by 2030 (Foreign Affairs)
Apple and Formula One announce a five-year US media rights deal for all races, starting in 2026; sources: Apple is paying ~$140M/year, up from ESPN's ~$85M/year (Alex Sherman/CNBC)
Amazon's Twitch begins testing livestream shopping ads that "keeps viewers immersed" to discover and buy products "in real time", starting with e.l.f. Cosmetics (Peter Adams/Marketing Dive)
